title: Job Vacancies at Charterhouse
content:
At Charterhouse, we aim to create a British-style international school reflecting the heritage and culture of the great UK independent schools. We are in search of courageous individuals who embrace challenges head-on and defy conventional expectations. We seek leaders who have the vision to set ambitious targets for students and staff; and who are unafraid to dream big and set lofty goals that will drive our school’s growth and success.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Secondary School Business Studies Teacher
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time
Job Category: Academics
Collaboration: Secondary School Colleagues
Reporting to: Head of Secondary / Head of Sixth Form

Role Overview
To provide an environment that allows for:


	World-class learning and teaching
	The holistic development of our students
	The attainment of high standards
	Collaborative professional practice
	Innovative and exciting learning opportunities within and beyond the classroom
	A clear focus on our guiding statements


Specific Responsibilities


	Support the school’s mission and vision.
	Work within the ethos and culture of Charterhouse Lagos.
	Provide for the student’s well-being, ensuring all aspects of their safety in accordance with the school’s health and safety policy, the safeguarding policy, and other protocols.
	Report to parents in line with the school’s reporting and assessment policy and procedures.
	Attend staff meetings and required professional development programmes.
	Work in collaboration with colleagues including academic, professional, and support staff.
	Plan and prepare teaching and learning in line with curriculum expectations and policies.
	Assess, track, and offer feedback on students’ achievement.
	Liaise and assist your line manager and colleagues with the efficient and effective day-to-day running of the school.
	Undertake supervisory duties as required.
	Understand and work within school policies and procedures.
	Lead the class team to provide high-quality first teaching.
	Support early identification of needs and deliver individual educational plans.
	Lead the class team to maintain and develop the learning environment.
	Act as a role model, showing awareness of children’s individual needs.
	Develop and maintain good relationships and communication with parents/carers.
	Undertake weekly boarding duties as required, plus two termly weekend days of boarding duties.


Our Expectations for Teachers:


	Students always come first
	Be positive, adaptable, and open to opportunities
	Be professional and ready to try something new
	Collaborate and communicate
	Model our school values
	Be committed to international-mindedness, equity, and sustainability


It will be essential that you offer an environment where:


	Every student is supported and safe
	Your pedagogy is based on evidence
	Every student receives a personalised and differentiated learning experience
	Expectations are that every student will succeed
	Students are empowered, motivated and engaged


Your professional practice will ensure that:


	Every student learns
	Students have agency and develop a love of learning
	Academic rigour is central to everything
	Well-being runs through every aspect of your pedagogy
	Learning is scaffolded and dynamic


Personal and Professional Development:


	Take part in performance development programmes.
	Attend professional learning and development training and share learnings.
	Stay aware of current trends in education.
	Have a positive and can-do mindset.
	Work effectively in a team.
	Contribute to the whole school community.
	Demonstrate core teaching competencies.
	Undertake any other duties reasonably required by the school.


Requirements
Essentials:


	Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in the subject to be taught or in a related discipline.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience teaching secondary school Business Studies.
	TRCN – Teachers Registration Council of Nigeria.
	Experience teaching GCSE / IGCSE.
	Experience teaching A Levels.

3.) School Bus Chaperone

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time
Job Category: Academics

Role Overview


	The successful candidate’s role will be to provide pastoral care and supervision by ensuring students are escorted safely to and from school while maintaining excellent customer service.


Responsibilities
Chaperone Duties


	Escort students safely from the designated pick-up point in Ikoyi at 6:00am to school in Ogombo.
	Supervise and ensure the orderly behaviour of all students during the journey.
	Maintain accurate records of attendance for all students travelling on the bus.
	Ensure students are safely collected and dropped off at authorised locations to adults authorized by the parents.
	Communicate proactively with parents and Line Manager regarding pick-up and drop-off arrangements.
	Respond appropriately and politely to messages or calls from parents during transit, maintaining professionalism and confidentiality.
	Work in partnership with the Driver to ensure a smooth, efficient, and safe service.
	Notify the Line Manager promptly of any delays, incidents, or significant traffic issues affecting arrival and departure times.


Safeguarding and Welfare:


	Ensure all children are safe, comfortable, and accounted for at all times.
	Report any safeguarding concerns immediately to the Designated Safeguarding Lead.
	Uphold the highest standards of child protection and professional conduct.


Qualification, Skills and Knowledge
Qualifications and Experience (Essential / Desirable):


	Candidates should possess a minimum of OND.
	Previous experience working with children or in a school environment.
	First Aid or Basic Safety training or willingness to obtain.
	Administrative, customer service or front-of -house experience.


Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong sense of responsibility and punctuality.
	Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize workload effectively.
	Professional appearance and demeanour.
	Ability to work collaboratively with staff, students, and parents.
	Strong judgement and ability to respond to issues appropriately while in transit.
	Knowledge of Lagos routes and traffic patterns.


Personal Traits:


	Resilient and adaptable to changing circumstances.
	Problem-solving skills and the ability to remain calm under pressure.
	Commitment to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children.
	Commitment to upholding the values and ethos of Charterhouse Lagos.
	A drive for excellence, an appreciation of the importance of education and an understanding and appreciation of the aims, mission and values of the school.

title: Job Openings at Dover Engineering
content:
Dover Engineering, a subsidiary of the Dover Group, is a leading engineering company with experience in delivering swift, cost-effective, and innovative solutions to clients across various industries.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Structural Design Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose / Objective
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To be part of the Civil/Structural discipline group within the organization, t provide leadership, technical assurance for the design, inspection, maintenance, and modification of civil structures, ensuring the reliability and availability of these structures at optimal whole lifecycle costs in line with company objectives as per business plan.


Basic functions & Principal Responsibilities:


	Lead and manage civil and structural tasks/projects from start to finish, by providing technical guidance regarding civil infrastructure design, construction, modifications and structural repairs and pro-actively coordinate with maintenance and project engineers to ensure that all civil related matters are addressed and in compliance to service level agreements (SLAs).
	Support the implementation of the civil Reliability Centred Maintenance (RCM) methodology for civil infrastructure assets (concrete and steel) to ensure effectiveness and optimization of assigned maintenance strategies
	.Facilitate the review of inspection findings for civil structures in the LNG plant and ensure risk view is available as input to the Civil Integrity Status Report (CISR)
	Assess customer’s requirements, site feasibility, and oversee review of final designs through inputs into the structural designs to ensure conformity to company’s design criteria, specifications, constructability and maintainability.
	Assure all engineered scaffold by ensuring that these are designed and installed according to applicable company procedures, industry standards and codes.
	Performing structural analysis and design for asset integrity assessment and life extension and apply principles of structural reliability to properly define the appropriate design rules for civil infrastructure
	Undertake frontend engineering studies as may be required to identify and develop performance improvement changes or scope of work for civil asset rejuvenation and ensure that all proposed modifications allow safe operation of facilities and maintain technical integrity.
	Provide assurance support with documented QA/QC records/documents for civil related activities on shutdowns/Turnarounds and routine maintenance execution to conform to relevant standards and achieve high integrity.
	Conducts execution of Inspection PMRs in conformance with the Inspection and Integrity assurance plans.
	Possess good understanding of metocean conditions and how they apply to design of topside structures.
	Records and updates accurate and detailed condition history for assigned equipment inspections in the CMMS (w-IMS & SAP)
	Identify and issue important T.R.A.I.N to manage civil infrastructures to mitigate threats and optimize opportunities 


Job requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree (B.Sc./B.Eng./B. Tech. or Equivalent) in civil/structural engineering Chartered status with NICE or NIStructE will be added advantage.


Experience:


	10 years of post-graduation experience in civil engineering practice, five years of which should be in structural engineering consulting preferably associated with the oil and gas industry.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should: Click here to apply online
And
send their CV to: careers@doverengineering.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Fabric Assurance Engineer 

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose / Objective


	To provide technical support and assurance on civil plant and infrastructure, maintenance and projects, ensuring that fabric designs, specifications and QA/QC programs comply with applicable industry standards for integrity and fitness of purpose, and that existing facilities are inspected and maintained to statutory industry standards, to realize and sustain value for Company.


Basic functions & Principal Responsibilities:


	 Assists in the identification and development of fabric scope of work for campaigns, turnarounds/shutdowns, and routine activities as directed by the Senior Engineer. 
	Provide QA support for fabric-related activities on shutdowns/turnarounds & routine maintenance execution to conform to relevant standards and achieve high integrity.
	Drive fabric maintenance lessons learnt input in the database and fabric condition and repair history in WIMS and CMMS for all critical tags highlighting trends to aid modification & planning as part of fabric systems improvement.4.Develop and update procedures and work instructions relevant to fabric and other civil.
	Maintains the QA/QC records/documents on projects, SDs & routine maintenance execution.
	Support provision of technical assurance by reviewing comments and steer on concept selections, detailed engineering designs and post design challenge resolutions for maintenance/campaigns/Turnarounds/projects.
	Deliver high levels of quality and customer support through reviews and timely response to RFI, RFQ, ERMT as per the SLA7.Proactively seeks out, intervenes and reports HSSE issues within and beyond area of influence 
	Contribute to Management of Change to fabric systems via design checks to affirm proposed modifications are technically feasible and appropriately detailed, ensuring additional execution/project deliverables like as-built documentation, are updated within approved processes for asset integrity, safety, and traceability. 
	Facilitates RCM studies to determine the best applicable Inspection & Maintenance strategy for civil assets and share outcome
	Undertake or co-ordinate failure investigations, as assigned, into coating failure and corrosion issues in accordance with prescribed or approved failure investigation procedures.
	Attend TAR meetings, AAR meetings, Asset Integrity meetings and technical reviews as required and maintain appropriate levels of contact with asset teams and third parties to ensure an effective fabric integrity service.


Job requirements
Education:


	B.Sc./B.Eng. degree in engineering (preferably in civil engineering)NSE/ COREN registration will be added advantage


Experience:


	10 years of post-graduation experience in fabric systems application & maintenance


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should: Click here to apply online
And
send their CV to: careers@doverengineering.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Spares and Materials Coordinator

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job role objective


	Support spares identification, specification and standardization, inventory management, contract and procurement interface management and integration, logistics coordination, equipment inventory and maintenance management, to ensure availability for effective and efficient maintenance of plant civil infrastructure assets.


Main Duties


	Identify spares for equipment and materials to support civil maintenance operations and implement a process to ensure availability.
	Collect/maintain spares master data file including full buying description and photographs and any other relevant technical/safety documentation, and load into the purchasing system to ensure standardization and facilitate procurement
	Establish min/max levels for all spares and materials, and track inventory levels and perform regular audits to prevent stock-out and overstocking.
	Provide technical support for the procurement process, including timely resolution of vendor queries, and management of relationship with the contract and procurement specialists to support own processes
	Identify and manage disposal of obsolete, surplus, moribund, or damaged (quarantine)items in the inventory, and identify replacement stock where applicable, to ensure availability of fit-for-purpose spares and materials
	Collaborate with discipline and construction engineers for resolution of specification issues to prevent supply of off-spec items to stock and reduce the risk of stock-outs.
	Maintain accurate records of all transactions related to spares issuance from the stores and procurement of new items to ensure visibility and traceability.
	Liaise with the planners/schedulers to ensure optimal deployment and utilization of the unit's equipment.
	Develop and implement stock review program to identify duplicates and determine wrongly grouped items to achieve cost avoidance/savings.
	Manage equipment inventory, and ensure availability to perform work
	Interface with equipment maintenance team for efficient and effective maintenance of all PMI equipment.
	Ensure all PMI equipment is managed, maintained and tracked within the plan.


Job Requirements
Education:      


	Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Civil/Mechanical/Electrical).


Experience:


	A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role in the oil and gas or manufacturing industry.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should: Click here to apply online
And
send their CV to: careers@doverengineering.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
